bug.author: Rodriq
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>System Information</denchmark-h>
TensorFlow version: 2.0 <denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/sets/difference>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r2.0/api_docs/python/tf/sets/difference</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Raises listed and defined</denchmark-h>
Raises not listed and defined. Every method has a way that it can be mishandled, maybe when a wrong parameter or wrong order of parameters is/are passed in ( e.g, in this case, two sets a and b in which the last elements don't match) will raise an error. <denchmark-h:h3>Request visuals, if applicable</denchmark-h>
No visuals <denchmark-h:h3>Submit a pull request?</denchmark-h>
No

comments.comment: Added a PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/29938>#29938</denchmark-link> for the fix.
